declarations.comments:
Implements the worker code that can later be called via the
`unsafeWorkerFromPath` function. This code _must_ be bundled such that
`main` is actually called in the file.
declarations.title: makeAsMain

declarations.comments:
Builds a new worker given a path to the compiled code constituting the `main`
function that should execute in the worker. The worker code should be created
using `makeAsMain`. The path must be either an absolute path or a relative
path that begins with ./ or ../

```purs
unsafeWorkerFromPath "./output/My.Bundled.Output/index.js"
```
declarations.title: unsafeWorkerFromPath

declarations.comments:
Instantiates a new worker thread. If this worker subscribes to input, it
will need to be cleaned up with `terminate`, otherwise it will hold your
process open.
declarations.title: spawn

declarations.comments: Sends some input to a worker thread to process.
declarations.title: post

contents.contents: is not known to be Sendable

declarations.comments:
Only Sendable things can be sent back and forth between a worker thread and
its parent. These include things that are represented by JavaScript primitives.
Arbitrary PureScript values cannot be sent, but variants, records and newtypes
of these things can. If you have a newtype of some Sendable, you must wrap it.
declarations.title: Sendable

declarations.comments: For newtypes that are otherwise Sendable.
declarations.title: SendWrapper

declarations.comments:
Use with care. If you send something that isn't actually Sendable, it
will raise an exception.
declarations.title: unsafeWrap

declarations.comments:
Instantiates a new worker thread. If this worker subscribes to input, it
will need to be cleaned up with `terminate`, otherwise it will hold your
process open. Yields a WorkerThread instance, and an AVar which can be
polled for results. Polling the AVar may result in an exception, and
if the worker has just exited, will yield an exit code.
declarations.title: spawn

declarations.comments: Sends some input to a worker thread to process.
declarations.title: post

declarations.comments:
Creates a new WorkerPool of some size. Worker threads will steal inputs as
they become available to do more work. It's assumed that a worker is only
processing one input, and yielding a corresponding output at a time. If a
worker may yield multiple results for a single input, you should not use
a worker pool.
declarations.title: make

declarations.comments: Terminates the pool and any propagates an exception to any pending invokers.
declarations.title: terminate

declarations.comments: Submits a new input to the worker pool, and waits for the reply.
declarations.title: invoke

declarations.comments: Creates a new pool of some size, terminating the pool when the scope exits.
declarations.title: withPool

declarations.comments: Traverses some input using a pool of some size.
declarations.title: poolTraverse
